title: Make Honor level progress visible?
body:
I Love the new honor system, it offers more choice  and it feels Kind of nicer in my opinion, BUT something i really feel like lacks is the overview of the Progress between 2 Honor Levels.

For example, if i am Honor Level 2, how do i know when i can ascend to Honor Level 3? where can i see how close i am to fall back into Honor 1?

It would be a lot easier if we had some Kind of Progress Bar showing, for example, you have a bar with 5 lines, being the honor Levels. If the Indicator moves towards the left, you are closer to Honor Level 5, if it goes right, you are closer to Honor Level 1, and each one of the 5 lines being said Honor Levels so you can not only see where you are with the Honor Level, but how far you have progressed in said Honor Level.

If there is no Progress-overview, i would very much welcome it if there was one.

And if there is one, and i am simply missing it, forgive my stupiditiy and i'd welcome it if anyone told me how to view it.

Cheers and have a nice game.

Exactly this. 

The only reason you would ever keep a reward system hidden is because it is designed to not truly be "progressive" and is instead a time-sink element.  

For example:  Let's say there is 1000 'points' needed to achieve the next level of honor.  You receive 1 'point' every time you are honored up to a maximum of 30 per week, you receive 2.5 points every week if you haven't been legitimately reported beyond a specific threshold and/or you engage in positive or neutral play, if you receive a certain amount of honors in a given 30 day period you receive 5 bonus points... etc.  There is always a hard cap to the number of points you can earn per week/month so that even if you are honored by all of your teammates every single game many times a day you will not achieve the next honor level any faster than another player per se.  

What I showed above is an example, but I am guessing that's actually kind of close to reality, because if there wasn't some type of cap---similar to what there is with chests, then someone would have hit honor level 3 by now... particularly those that stream and receive 3-4 honors per game, times 15 games per day.  

-
**BOTTOM LINE**:  It's actually a pretty poor design.  Why?  Because if players aren't seeing regular progress they will become less engaged in the system and overtime the incentive for good behavior becomes less appealing, particularly when they see their favorite streamer playing 15 games per day and getting multiple honors yet not progressing.  

Obviously those that designed the system are great at math and programming, but never took a social science course in their life and most certainly didn't have a social science specialist, psychologist or sociologist help in the basic architecture of the system.

> Hey, this is a good question, but we actually very intentionally did not include any sort of progress indicator for Honor levels. Here are a few reasons why:
> 
> 1. We didn't want to anchor people on the "grind" to honor levels. By not having progress indicators, we wanted to root the reinforcement for being sportsmanlike on the feedback you get from other players (the honors), not any artificial motivation from being "close to the next level". 
> 2. Our behind-the-scenes systems which determine honor level ups aren't simple. The types of calculations we do to determine if a player is ready to level up take into account their holistic behavior across many games, and don't lend themselves well to being surfaced in an "XP bar"-style system. Anything we surface here could also warp behavior around trying to "minmax" the most honor points, which really refocuses it away from the point of the Honor system - play good games and you'll make progress.
> 3. We wanted to have a few discrete levels in Honor, since bloating the number would make each feel less meaningful. However, we wanted players to progress over the course of a season or half-season, which means that progress to the next level would necessarily be fairly slow. We didn't think it would be a great experience to reinforce this through some progress indicator.
